trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Update the quickstart client app to capture and upload images
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Update the quickstart client app to capture and upload images

trans-unit.source: In this section you will update the project from the [Get started with Mobile Services] tutorial to take photos and upload them to Azure Blob Storage.
trans-unit.target: In this section you will update the project from the [Get started with Mobile Services] tutorial to take photos and upload them to Azure Blob Storage.

trans-unit.source: To capture the image, this tutorial uses the [CameraCaptureTask] from the Microsoft.Phone.Tasks namespace.
trans-unit.target: To capture the image, this tutorial uses the [CameraCaptureTask] from the Microsoft.Phone.Tasks namespace.

trans-unit.source: This class launches the camera UI on the Windows Phone device to capture the photo and automatically saves the image to the Camera Roll on the Windows Phone device.
trans-unit.target: This class launches the camera UI on the Windows Phone device to capture the photo and automatically saves the image to the Camera Roll on the Windows Phone device.

trans-unit.source: If you do not want the images saved to the Camera Roll, use the [PhotoCamera] class in the Microsoft.Devices namespace instead.
trans-unit.target: If you do not want the images saved to the Camera Roll, use the [PhotoCamera] class in the Microsoft.Devices namespace instead.

trans-unit.source: In the Solution Explorer for Visual Studio, under the project, expand Properties.
trans-unit.target: In the Solution Explorer for Visual Studio, under the project, expand Properties.

trans-unit.source: Then open the WMAppManifest.xml file and on the Capabilities tab enable the camera by clicking ID\_CAP\_ISV\_CAMERA.
trans-unit.target: Then open the WMAppManifest.xml file and on the Capabilities tab enable the camera by clicking ID\_CAP\_ISV\_CAMERA.

trans-unit.source: Close the file to save your change.
trans-unit.target: Close the file to save your change.

trans-unit.source: This makes sure that your app can use a camera attached to the computer.
trans-unit.target: This makes sure that your app can use a camera attached to the computer.

trans-unit.source: Users will be requested to allow camera access the first time that the app is run.
trans-unit.target: Users will be requested to allow camera access the first time that the app is run.

trans-unit.source: Open the MainPage.xaml file and replace the Grid element named ContentPanel with the following code:
trans-unit.target: Open the MainPage.xaml file and replace the Grid element named ContentPanel with the following code:

trans-unit.source: This adds a new button to launch the [CameraCaptureTask] and adds an image to the ItemTemplate and sets its binding source as the URI of the uploaded image in the Blob Storage service.
trans-unit.target: This adds a new button to launch the [CameraCaptureTask] and adds an image to the ItemTemplate and sets its binding source as the URI of the uploaded image in the Blob Storage service.

trans-unit.source: Open the MainPage.xaml.cs project file and add the following using statements:
trans-unit.target: Open the MainPage.xaml.cs project file and add the following using statements:

trans-unit.source: In the MainPage.xaml.cs project file, update the TodoItem class by adding the following properties:
trans-unit.target: In the MainPage.xaml.cs project file, update the TodoItem class by adding the following properties:

trans-unit.source: In the MainPage.xaml.cs project file, update the MainPage class.
trans-unit.target: In the MainPage.xaml.cs project file, update the MainPage class.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code to declare the [CameraCaptureTask] and a stream object that will reference the captured image:
trans-unit.target: Add the following code to declare the [CameraCaptureTask] and a stream object that will reference the captured image:

trans-unit.source: In the MainPage.xaml.cs project file, update the MainPage class.
trans-unit.target: In the MainPage.xaml.cs project file, update the MainPage class.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code to update the constructor to create the CameraCaptureTask and add an event handler for the Completed event:
trans-unit.target: Add the following code to update the constructor to create the CameraCaptureTask and add an event handler for the Completed event:

trans-unit.source: In the MainPage.xaml.cs project file, update the MainPage class.
trans-unit.target: In the MainPage.xaml.cs project file, update the MainPage class.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code that displays the camera UI to allow the user to capture an image when the Capture Image button is clicked:
trans-unit.target: Add the following code that displays the camera UI to allow the user to capture an image when the Capture Image button is clicked:

trans-unit.source: In the MainPage.xaml.cs project file, update the MainPage class.
trans-unit.target: In the MainPage.xaml.cs project file, update the MainPage class.

trans-unit.source: Replace the existing InsertTodoItem method with the following code:
trans-unit.target: Replace the existing InsertTodoItem method with the following code:

trans-unit.source: This code sends a request to the mobile service to insert a new TodoItem, including the image file name.
trans-unit.target: This code sends a request to the mobile service to insert a new TodoItem, including the image file name.

trans-unit.source: The response contains the SAS, which is then used to insert the image in the Blob store, and the URI of the image for data binding.
trans-unit.target: The response contains the SAS, which is then used to insert the image in the Blob store, and the URI of the image for data binding.

trans-unit.source: The final step is to test the app and validate that uploads succeed.
trans-unit.target: The final step is to test the app and validate that uploads succeed.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Test uploading the images in your app
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Test uploading the images in your app

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, you can press the F5 key to test the app in the emulator or with an actual device targeted.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, you can press the F5 key to test the app in the emulator or with an actual device targeted.

trans-unit.source: Enter some text in the textbox, then click Capture Image.
trans-unit.target: Enter some text in the textbox, then click Capture Image.

trans-unit.source: This displays the camera capture UI.
trans-unit.target: This displays the camera capture UI.

trans-unit.source: Click the image or the snapshot button on the phone to take a picture.
trans-unit.target: Click the image or the snapshot button on the phone to take a picture.

trans-unit.source: Click accept to accept the image and exit the camera UI.
trans-unit.target: Click accept to accept the image and exit the camera UI.

trans-unit.source: Click Save to insert the new item and upload the image.
trans-unit.target: Click Save to insert the new item and upload the image.

trans-unit.source: The new item, along with the uploaded image, is displayed in the list view.
trans-unit.target: The new item, along with the uploaded image, is displayed in the list view.

trans-unit.source: The image is downloaded automatically from the Blob Storage service when the <html></html>imageUri<html></html> property of the new item is bound to the <html></html>Image<html></html> control.
trans-unit.target: The image is downloaded automatically from the Blob Storage service when the <html></html>imageUri<html></html> property of the new item is bound to the <html></html>Image<html></html> control.
